intro: Melitella, commonly known as the common melitaea, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce small, clustered flowers that are often white or pink in color. Melitella species are known for their aromatic properties and are sometimes used in traditional medicine. They thrive in well-drained soils and require a warm, humid climate for optimal growth.
